channel.title: My auto typer. first script ever! (i dint even know it was possible)
channel.description:
here it is its an autotalk may suck but its a start i give most of the credit to my freind since his script help me make this one :D
[code] program lordslayersautotalker; procedure talk; begin sendkeyssilent('blah!'+chr(13))//edit the purple text to make it say stuff dotn take out the 'or the' tho wait(1000) end; begin repeat talk; until(false) end. [/code]

item.title: My auto typer. first script ever! (i dint even know it was possible)
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Here’s a sexy version of your script. All credits go to you.

[scar]
Program LordSlayersAutoTalker;

Const
// Colors and Effects work fine.
// Remember Colors first then Effects like this…
// white:glow2:your message
Msg = ‘Place your message here.’;

Procedure Talk;
Begin
SendKeysSilent(Msg+chr(13))
Wait(1000+Random(4000))
End;

Begin
Repeat
Talk;
Until(False)
End.
[/scar]

~Ron

Read full topic
item.source: My auto typer. first script ever! (i dint even know it was possible)

item.title: My auto typer. first script ever! (i dint even know it was possible)
item.dc:creator: @rabcarl rabcarl
item.description:
@rabcarl wrote:

Yeah, nice script. Try putting code tags on your script. It would look a lot cleaner.
So write two square brackets like this [] with the word “code” in the beginning of it, and then write [] with “/code” in it at the end. (Minus the quotation marks, of course)
It would look like this:

program lordslayersautotalker;
procedure talk;
begin
sendkeyssilent('blah!'+chr(13))//edit the purple text to make it say stuff dotn take out the 'or the' tho
wait(1000)
end;
begin
repeat
talk;
until(false)
end.

Read full topic
